definition: Having a thin edge or point that can cut or pierce something.
example_sentence: The knife had a sharp blade.

definition: Willing to try new or difficult things, or to take risks.
example_sentence: She was an adventurous traveler, always seeking out new experiences.

definition: Showing an ability to take risks; confident and courageous.
example_sentence: The knight made a bold move to save the princess.

definition: Adventurous and willing to take risks.
example_sentence: It was a daring plan to climb the treacherous mountain.

definition: Not deterred by danger or pain; brave.
example_sentence: The firefighter was courageous in the face of the fire.

definition: Ready to face and endure danger or pain; showing courage.
example_sentence: The soldiers were brave in the face of enemy fire.

definition: Showing a lack of courage or confidence; easily frightened.
example_sentence: The timid child hid behind her mother.

definition: Lacking courage; easily frightened.
example_sentence: His cowardly actions were condemned by everyone.

definition: A person who lacks courage; someone easily frightened.
example_sentence: He was called a coward for running away from the fight.

definition: Willing to undertake new and daring enterprises.
example_sentence: They embarked on an adventurous journey across the continent.

definition: growing or developing successfully; flourishing
example_sentence: The thriving business expanded rapidly.

definition: in advance; before something else happens or is done
example_sentence: They decided to book the tickets beforehand to secure their seats.

definition: before the time that something is expected to happen
example_sentence: You need to pay in advance to reserve your spot.

definition: at a previous time; before the present
example_sentence: He had previously worked as a software engineer.

definition: (of a sound) loud and harsh
example_sentence: The blaring music made it impossible to concentrate.

definition: (of a sound) loud and harsh
example_sentence: The blaring music was coming from the next apartment.

definition: a stupid or careless mistake
example_sentence: The politician made a major blunder during the interview.

definition: to do something wrong or make an error that has important or negative consequences
example_sentence: The accountant made a serious mistake when preparing the company's financial statements.

definition: to make a stupid or careless mistake
example_sentence: He made a blunder by revealing the secret during the meeting.

definition: (of a person or remark) candid and straightforward; not trying to be polite
example_sentence: She was blunt with her criticism of the project.

definition: To produce flowers; to thrive.
example_sentence: The roses will bloom in the spring.

definition: To begin to grow or increase rapidly; to flourish.
example_sentence: The company's profits began to burgeon after the new marketing campaign.

definition: To grow or cause to grow and become more mature, advanced, or elaborate.
example_sentence: The city continues to develop new infrastructure to support its growing population.

definition: To increase in size or amount; to develop.
example_sentence: The plant grew quickly in the sunlight.

definition: To grow or develop in a healthy or vigorous way, especially as the result of a favorable environment.
example_sentence: The arts scene is flourishing in the city.

definition: To succeed in a financial or business way; to thrive.
example_sentence: The new business is expected to prosper in the coming years.

definition: To grow vigorously; to prosper; to flourish.
example_sentence: The new plants thrived in the rich soil.

definition: Producing flowers; flourishing.
example_sentence: The garden was filled with blooming flowers.

definition: Growing or developing successfully; thriving.
example_sentence: The flourishing business expanded to multiple locations.

definition: Successful in material terms; flourishing financially.
example_sentence: The company enjoyed a prosperous year with record profits.
